Hot Dice has 2 scores to track, the running score and total score.

A player rolls 6 dice to start and must retain at least 1 scoring die per roll. They may end their turn any time and transfer their running score to the total score or continue to roll their remaining dice, BUT

  • If no scoring dice are ever rolled, the player BUSTS, ending their turn and losing their running score.
  • If all dice score, the player has HOT DICE! and gets to roll all 6 dice again while maintaining their running score.

This process is repeated until a playerâ€™s total score is 10,000.

    Boxcars: six dice combinations
  • six of a kind of 1s = 4000 points
  • six of a kind = 3200 points
  • a straight (1,2,3,4,5,6) = 3200 points
  • three pairs = 3200 points
  • two triple sets = 3200 points
  • Five of a kind = Die value x 100 x 2 x 2 points
  • Four of a kind = Die value x 100 x 2 points
  • Three of a kind = Die value x 100 points
  • Single 1 = 100 points
  • Single 5 = 500 points
